articles.title: WFTU joins in signature campaign
articles.content:
WFTU joins in signature campaign 
    Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- The political advisor to the World Federation of Trade Unions (WFTU) signed the signature paper on July 15 on behalf of 240 million members to support the June 15 inter-Korean joint declaration and demand the immediate withdrawal of the U.S. troops from South Korea.
 Meanwhile, the executive secretary of the Latin American Institute of the Juche Idea joined in the signature campaign.

articles.title: KCTU reunification vanguard formed in S. Korea
articles.content:
KCTU reunification vanguard formed in S. Korea 
     Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- An inaugural ceremony of the 3rd-term reunification vanguard of the (South) Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) was reportedly held at Kyung Sung University in Seoul on August 3.
 The vanguard declared that it would conduct reunification movement such as visit to major areas of South Korea where struggles are going on, to express solidarity with them. It would also pay a protest visit to the U.S. military bases across South Korea and tour different areas to encourage workers in their struggle.    
 On August 4, the organization sponsored a signature campaign and a photo exhibition to denounce GIs for having killed schoolgirls.

articles.title: DPRK, China cooperate
articles.content:
DPRK, China cooperate 
    Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- An agreement on cooperation in standardization, measuring and quality of goods was signed between the bureau of quality control of the DPRK and the certification and accreditation administration of China in Beijing on Tuesday.
 The agreement was inked by the vice-director of the bureau and the deputy administrator of the administration.

Greetings to Singaporean President
articles.content:
Greetings to Singaporean President 
    Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, Friday sent a message of greetings to Singaporean President S. R. Nathan on the occasion of the National Day.
 He in the message extended warm congratulations to the president, government and people of Singapore and sincerely wished him success in his work for the country's prosperity.

articles.title: Korean people's struggle supported by Mongolian President
articles.content:
Korean people's struggle supported by Mongolian President
     Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- Mongolian President Natsagiin Bagabandi expressed support to the Korean people in the struggle to achieve the peaceful reunification of the country by the concerted efforts of the Korean nation according to the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration when he received DPRK foreign minister Paek Nam Sun on a visit to Mongolia on August 8.
 Highly praising the Korean people for their great success in the efforts to build a powerful nation under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il, the president hoped that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would develop in different fields.

articles.title: Treaty and protocol signed between DPRK and Mongolia
articles.content:
Treaty and protocol signed between DPRK and Mongolia
    Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- A ceremony of signing the treaty of friendly relations and cooperation between the DPRK and Mongolia and the protocol between the DPRK and Mongolian governments on the effectuation of bilateral agreements in the DPRK-Mongolian relations was held in Ulaan Baatar on August 8.
 The documents were inked by the DPRK and Mongolian foreign ministers.

articles.title: Talks held between DPRK and Mongolian foreign ministers
articles.content:
Talks held between DPRK and Mongolian foreign ministers
    Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- Talks were held between DPRK foreign minister Paek Nam Sun and Mongolian minister of foreign affairs Luvsangiin Erdenechuluun in Ulaan Baatar on Thursday.
 At the talks both sides informed each other of the situation in their countries and exchanged views on the issue of developing the bilateral relations and issues of mutual concern.    
 Present at the talks from the DPRK side were the party of Paek Nam Sun and from the Mongolian side the secretary of state of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the Mongolian Ambassador to the DPRK and officials concerned.
